2. Zinc acetate: It is a chemical compound that is used topically or orally for various therapeutic purposes. In this context, it is mentioned in relation to the treatment of lichenoid dermatitis in a patient with Wilson's disease. Lichenoid dermatitis is a type of inflammatory skin condition that can be caused by various factors, including medications like Penicillamine. Zinc acetate is sometimes used to help alleviate the symptoms of lichenoid dermatitis.
